posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.30 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you’d like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium!

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

No new notes, mostly bug fixes and non-visible changes!

Complete list of new commits since 7.29.4
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.29.4…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

I know many of you have been expiencing performance issues with the calls tab – 7.30 should help a lot! We ripped out a very expensive sql query and got the data a different way. On my S24 device (which has ~1300 calls), loading the calls tab went from 1.5-3sec down to ~60ms :) I hope the rest of you see similar improvements!

That said, because of that major change, please let us know if the calls tab isn’t behaving correctly, or if it’s still noticeably slow.

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Obtainium
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.29 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.30.0 (150200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

57 new commits since 7.29.4:

Show commits

  • Update to RingRTC v2.49.2 [1]

  • Fix dangling open cursors in AnalyzeDatabaseJob. [2]

  • Do not include identity message from self in backup. [3]

  • Update KeepMessageDuration for 1 year to 366 days. [4]

    This allows you to see messages that are exactly one year old (like
    birthday wishes) as well as accounts for leap year.
    Resolves #13889

  • Convert tests to Kotlin, remove Hamcrest. [5]

    Resolves #13884

  • Convert tests from Hamcrest -> AssertK. [6]

  • Convert StickerTable to kotlin. [7]

  • Dedupe packs when reading from sticker table. [8]

  • Fix 1:1 call unknown state validation failure. [9]

  • Mitigate PNI editor server bug for group member add updates. [10]

  • Add whoami check for receipt_credentials. [11]

  • Add wake lock when linking devices. [12]

  • Ensure that ANR traces are kept within a reasonable size range. [13]

  • Ensure that backup timestamps are within a certain range. [14]

  • Mitigate flaky network by retrying link+sync api calls. [15]

  • Update libsignal to 0.65.0 [16]

  • Enable the SSRE2 capability. [17]

  • Fix test compilation issues. [18]

  • Fix expirationTime for call links. [19]

  • Add ability to cancel a link+sync. [20]

  • Claim IAP subscription if we detect a payment token mismatch. [21]

  • Fix DatabaseConsistencyCheck SQL normalizer. [22]

  • Remove comment about checking for easy label. [23]

    Resolves #13897

  • Prevent changing to the same phone number. [24]

    Fixes #13864
    Resolvse #13883

  • Prevent overlapping contact refreshes. [25]

    Fixes #13852
    Resolves #13874

  • Improve error handling for serialized job data. [26]

  • Attempt to rebuild the FTS index in DB error handler. [27]

  • Fix gv2 left group locally bugs in backup and compose. [28]

  • Prevent calls crashing due to background restrictions. [29]

  • Notify a user when they link a device. [30]

  • Validate serviceIds in pinned chats. [31]

  • Remove unused ToggleRow.enabled flag. [32]

  • Story Privacy Setting UI issues [33]

    Fixes #13863
    Resolves #13892

  • Fix cropping on large images. [34]

  • Add app migration for SSRE2 capability. [35]

  • Introduce additional logging for group call updates. [36]

  • Handle nonretryable errors during link + sync. [37]

  • Fix country picker reproducible builds bug. [38]

  • Add polling for devices. [39]

  • Exclude invalid long messages from backups. [40]

  • Fix incorrect registration challenge handling when requesting verification codes. [41]

  • Add small system for consolidating archive export errors. [42]

  • Fix incorrect left group in local state bug. [43]

  • Fix progress display hiding way before registration navigation. [44]

    Fixes #13850
    Closes #13898

  • Remove fix group left incorrectly migration job. [45]

  • Update libsignal to 0.65.1 [46]

  • Add backup support for contact nicknames and notes. [47]

  • Update to libsignal 0.65.2 [48]

  • Remove bad instrumentation test. [49]

  • Add backup support for DirectStoryReplyMessages. [50]

  • Fix do not disturb settings for calls. [51]

  • Fix header mode when call is reconnecting. [52]

  • Add date to unlinked dialog. [53]

  • Improve call tab performance. [54]

  • Update translations and other static files. [55]

  • Update baseline profile. [56]

  • Bump version to 7.30.0 [57]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.29.4…v7.30.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.cooked: I’ve not had any issues with the calls tab, but just wanted to point out the first sentence in your post should probably say 7.30 instead of 7.29

greyson-signal:

your post should probably say 7.30 instead of 7.29

while the 7.30.0 tag exists, it’s not marked as a release and there’s no apk

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
Continuing the discussion from Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.29 release:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.29 release

We’re making a change in 7.30 to allow things to self-heal without the need for an update.

Unfortunately the problem hasn’t fully self-healed. Messages sent via Desktop won’t show up on Android, on the same groups, even though there’s no membership issue.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.30.0/464c9c28e4c78a933c3abd6e6fa67f65e153d5482ed6ee0d51bbd74a7348a995

P.S.: As a workaround It’s possible to resolve the problem by manually sending a message from Android to each group, but you might miss a few messages in-between.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.29 release

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
Xashyar:

Unfortunately the problem hasn’t fully self-healed. Messages sent via Desktop won’t show up on Android, on the same groups, even though there’s no membership issue.

I see in the android logs where we resolve the issue locally for one of your groups. Did you open the other groups that got hit with this issue if you have more than one? Until you open a group and have the app update the group state, you won’t receive messages from anyone.

If you’ve done the above, and still aren’t receiving a message from your linked desktop? Do you know if others are getting the message sent on desktop? Could you repro, provide a desktop and android debuglog, and the timestamp so I can try to cross-reference between the two what’s happening?

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
cody-signal:

I see in the android logs where we resolve the issue locally for one of your groups.

I think that happened after I manually sent a message from Android to that specific group.

But I can reproduce this with another group.

cody-signal:

Do you know if others are getting the message sent on desktop?

Yes.

Timestamp from Desktop: 1737141911825

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.39.0-beta.1/8f2fb12ee6e019031e4654f9cf0f7ba1f80f8b4d8899aa1861488101d68aafeb.gz

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.30.0/bfbed8edd8c4ba551afb6ccf4b3932f1baa1a9fea253093b8bb5ad4290addc73

New Version: 7.30.1 (150300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

7 new commits since 7.30.0:

  • Add potential fix for some users in the v191 database migration. [1]

    Relates to #13034

  • Update backup export to remove storySentTimestamp. [2]

  • Add backup support for direct story reply revisions. [3]

  • Remove improper clamping of muteUntilMs. [4]

  • Improve backup validation of empty items. [5]

  • Update translations and other static files. [6]

  • Bump version to 7.30.1 [7]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I’m 90% sure I didn’t disable read receipts but they were off for some reason?

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.30.1/33f43aa7fbc52c468f6bed2960785afcbe43b4fc8364216a5277f1c9b8f0f25a

Deleting a call link by long clicking it in the call tab doesn’t work. Just nothing happens.
Using “delete call link” at the details page does work normally, though.

Edit: it’s not limited to call links. Any element in the call list can’t be deleted.

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
Confirmed. v7.30.1

Debug Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.30.1/c778d61b0451bef7f46ea32bc583d4177377f8143f209a43090f21ee5bf44e78

Scheduled message with images or videos never show the time they are due to. Neither when they contain additional text or media only. Can somebody confirm?

signal-2025-01-19-18-56-19-0241024×2105 136 KB

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

I’m 90% sure I didn’t disable read receipts but they were off for some reason?

Looks like it was disabled by one of your linked devices around this time: 2025-01-17 23:12:56.954 GMT+01:00. Any idea which one that might be, and whether you could get a log?

fm-sys:

Edit: it’s not limited to call links. Any element in the call list can’t be deleted.

Will take a look

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
greyson-signal:

Looks like it was disabled by one of your linked devices around this time: 2025-01-17 23:12:56.954 GMT+01:00. Any idea which one that might be, and whether you could get a log?

I can try, I have a few which might be problematic and I think it may have been iOS which I have reset multiple times.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.39.0-beta.1/d960b6550a79c7c7bd1d9b43e6cb88bb291387bdeea8b52dd937d3e9424a3e24.gz

I see that iOS Signal on iPad exposes this option even though it is a linked device:
https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.43.0/99f33507b567033544c6e3f90c0a7dc0ad25906502bec2da15fac5b2d854056c.zip

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.39.0-beta.1/7b85925014a293cdf10c7b7839715a20501f8f6f2cf0a667eda6372dc7182ec4.gz

Not getting notifications that new contacts joined signal

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.30.0/2316dc803fa368d2c81e8f001368d3fded6201683012eedaccad6d8266060060

I know this is unsupported, but I know my new contact joined because I was notified via the Molly client, which did generate a notification.

I still have the bug reports for delayed notifications, I’ll upload them and share them privately later today.
Only after refreshing my contacts on my main device did I get a notification that my new contact joined. Nothing at all on desktop (Intel Mac) either.
